meanings.definition: Water that is dark or murky in color due to the presence of organic matter.
meanings.sent1: The pond was filled with blackwater after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent2: The swamp's blackwater reflected the dark storm clouds above.
meanings.sent3: The blackwater in the river made it look like a giant cup of tea.
meanings.sent4: The blackwater of the lake seemed to swallow all the light around it.
meanings.sent5: The blackwater of the well was so murky, you couldn't see your own hand in it.

meanings.definition: Wastewater from toilets, which contains human waste and is typically treated separately from other types of wastewater.
meanings.sent1: The treatment plant processed the blackwater efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The blackwater from the bathroom needed to be disposed of carefully.
meanings.sent3: The blackwater leak in the house caused quite a stinky situation.
meanings.sent4: The blackwater flowed through the pipes like a foul river of shame.
meanings.sent5: The blackwater overflowed, creating a mess that no one wanted to clean up.
